I'm having issues with the sound - it's as if the db that indexes sound files is bullocksed up and it plays sound files at the right places, only the wrong sounds. Too bad... :-/

I'm having issues getting this to work. I downloaded and extracted it, then ran the .bat file. It takes me to a loading screen ("loading game content") and a splash screen with The One Eyed Dude and a list of people he wants to thank... then the only way to get out of that screen is to hit Escape. When I do that I get the message "d3dx9_25.dll was not found" or something like that. I have that file in my C:\WINDOWS\system32 folder, along with the rest of my DX9 files. So why doesn't the batch file find it?

http://www.dll-files.com/dllindex/dll-files.shtml?d3dx9_25
go there and download this to your folder (game) or reinstall directx completly!...

nope drivers are updated does shit(already have the latest so i dont know wtf subzeros on about)

only part that is in order is the ryan piece at the begining as soon as atlas starts telling you to pick up radio of which you wont here unless youve turned subtitles on, it still out of audio cue(the aphrodite piece is played which again after playing retail copy is out of place until further in the game same goes for when you save the kids the old bints cue is a mixture of the incorecct audio piece,s and past radio conversations)
i think what sub is thinking is tht our sounds are corrupt this is not the case ,sound is perfect its JUST not in trhe order of when its lined up to come into play 
if your wanting to play turn subtitles on and turn
voice over volume to zero 
youll still get annoying looping of some spoken sound bites but the game will play along alot better than being misled about the storey

Ok, found a way to solve the problem. Definatly faulty libary files in the "Sounds_windows" folder, but only for level 1 fortunatly. Got hold of the Bioshock demo, and use the level 1 files from the demo and overwrite the files found in this rip. Problem solved, Level 2 (Or rather the medical lab) files are perfectly fine so no worrys. Enjoy

People with sound issues, I have figuered out how to fix it, 
-Run down on Problem- The audio files kinda work, they are just mixed up,
-Solution- Get new audio files, http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/3801473/Bioshock_sound_files this is the link for them, down load them 

-installation- after the torrent go into your Bioshock folder and open Content, Sounds_window, Delete the files in there at the bottom, and Paste the new downloaded ones in. Simple as that
